title: Maine man leads police on high-speed chase, allegedly rams police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Crime He was charged with operating under the influence, eluding an officer, reckless conduct, and criminal speed.

By Molly Farrar November 30, 2025 | 6:04 PM 1 minute to read A Maine man led police on a high-speed chase early Sunday morning that crossed state lines after he allegedly crashed into a New Hampshire State Police cruiser, authorities said.
Matthew Olsen, 44, of Harrison, was arrested on I-95 after driving over a curb at the Kennebunk Rest Area.

title: Patriots QB Tommy DeVito hopes New England blows out Giants on Monday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "When I was there, it was, ‘Go Giants’ but now it’s ‘Go Pats’ all the way.
" Tommy DeVito spent the last two seasons with the Giants.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan November 30, 2025 | 5:36 PM 2 minutes to read There appears to be no love lost between Tommy DeVito and his former team in the Giants.

title: Mass. lawmakers hold hearing on immigration bill that would ban police from asking about status
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The bill, known as the Safe Communities Act, was proposed in response to the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.
The proposed bill would implement several protections for immigrants in civil matters.

Erin Hooley/AP Photo By Darin Zullo November 30, 2025 | 11:28 AM 2 minutes to read Massachusetts lawmakers are considering a proposed law that would create new protections for immigrant communities in response to the Trump administration’s crackdown.

title: Graduate student allegedly stabbed passengers with fork aboard flight diverted to Logan Airport
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The international flight landed in Boston after the Indian student allegedly stabbed two boys with the fork, according to court documents.
The flight landed unexpectedly at Logan Airport after the student allegedly stabbed two passengers with a metal fork.
David L Ryan/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo November 30, 2025 | 9:55 AM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Joe Mazzulla makes comical football comparison to avoid negative comments about officiating
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics Mazzulla's response clearly carried some frustration toward the officiating of a particular play in Saturday's game.
Joe Mazzulla found a clever way to criticize the officiating of Saturday's game.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) Joe Mazzulla is hardly a stranger to humorous lines and interesting comparisons when talking to the media, and he delivered another golden nugget on Saturday night.

title: Neemias Queta posts career highs in points and rebounds in Celtics loss to Timberwolves
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics Queta scored 19 points and had 18 rebounds matching up against Rudy Gobert on Saturday night.
Neemias Queta had the best game of his NBA career on Saturday night.
(AP Photo/Lily Dozier) Neemias Queta had somewhat of a slow start to his first season as a starting center, but his development over the last few weeks has been a positive for the middling Celtics.

title: Celtics fall to Anthony Edwards, Timberwolves despite Jaylen Brown’s huge game: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Boston Celtics Brown put up 41 points in the loss.
Jaylen Brown's Herculean performance wasn't enough to topple the Timberwolves on Saturday.
